```{r, echo = FALSE}
expr <- function(s) (400)/(s^2+12*s+400)
x_zero <- c()
y_zero <- c()
x_pole <- c(-6,-6)
y_pole <- c(-2*sqrt(91),2*sqrt(91))
pole_zero_plot(x_zero, y_zero, x_pole, y_pole, 20,expr,1.25)

```
Vi har:

$$
G(s) = 400 \cdot \frac{1}{s^2+12s+400}
$$

$$
C(s) = \frac{1}{s} \cdot 400 \cdot \frac{1}{s^2+12s+400} = 400 \cdot \frac{1}{s(s^2+12s+400)}
$$

Her er polparret: 

$$
p =-6 \pm 2\sqrt{91} = -6\pm 19.08
$$

Det giver følgende underdæmpede step respons

$$
c(t) = A + B e^{-\sigma t} + cos(\omega t - \phi) 
$$
Hvor 
$$
\sigma = 6 \quad \omega = 19.08
$$

Altså:

$$
c(t) = A + B e^{-6 t} + cos(19.08 t - \phi) 
$$
